title: Get a Creality 3D printer at an all-time low pricing until Christmas up to $300 off K2 series with CFS bundle
summary: Get Creality's K2 combo deals on K2, K2 Pro, and K2 Plus with up to $300 off this Christmas season.

title: Dell preps massive price hikes up to 30% citing memory pricing 'out of our control'
summary: Dell will raise prices on RAM, storage, GPU, and monitor upgrades for corporate clients starting December 17, citing high memory costs.

title: New app injects AMD's AI-driven FSR Redstone framegen into unsupported games
summary: A Reddit user demonstrated AMD's new ML-powered FSR Redstone frame generation running in Monster Hunter Wilds, a game that never supported it. The pre-alpha OptiScaler build showed nice improvements over legacy FSR frame gen.

title: Industry preps new 'cheap' HBM4 memory spec with narrow interface, but it isn't a GDDR killer
summary: JEDEC's new SPHBM4 spec enables full HBM4 bandwidth over a 512-bit interface using a 4:1 serialization and supports up to 64 GB per stack with 2.5D integration on organic substrates.

title: Snag $760 worth of hardware for $469, including 32GB of DDR5 memory worth $407, in this stellar bundle deal   32GB of DDR5 memory, Intel Z890 motherboard, and 280mm liquid cooler included
summary: This RAM-inspired bundle deal from Newegg includes a 32GB DDR5 kit from Corsair, an Intel Z890 motherboard, and a 280mm AIO cooler.

title: Nvidia details new software that enables location tracking for AI GPUs
summary: Nvidia's GPU fleet management software is optional for clients and includes features like power usage tracking, thermal monitoring, and location tracking of processors. The software can also detect hotspots, anomalies, and software errors. Clients can opt-in to remote data center GPU fleet management.

title: $40 billion-plus crypto fraud scheme results in 15-year prison sentence for its creator nine criminal counts include wire fraud and money laundering
summary: Terra Project's crypto mogul Do Kwon jailed for 15 years

title: Creality Falcon2 Pro 60 Watt Laser Engraver review: Deep cuts and fine engravings
summary: The Creality Falcon2 Pro 60W is a fully enclosed diode laser engraver with multiple safety features, capable of making deep cuts and fine engravings.

title: Germany summons Russian ambassador over GRU-linked cyberattacks air traffic control and elections systems targeted
summary: Germany has formally summoned Russia's ambassador in Berlin after publicly attributing a series of cyber and influence operations to Moscow's GRU military intelligence agency.

title: Bitcoin creator Satoshi disappeared on this day 15 years ago, leaving a final public message   'I've moved on to other things,' true identity of Satoshi Nakamoto entity remains unknown
summary: The presumed pseudonymous Bitcoin creator, Satoshi Nakamoto, disappeared without a trace on this day in 2010.

title: AMD, Intel, and TI are  merchants of death says lawyer representing Ukrainian civilians five new suits complain that Russian drones and missiles continue to use high-tech components from these brands
summary: Five lawsuits were filed in Texas this week, putting some of the biggest names in PC tech under an uncomfortable spotlight, as their components are still being found in Russian weaponry.

title: Nvidia weighs expanding H200 production as new China orders rush in, report claims
summary: Nvidia is evaluating whether to increase production of its H200 data center GPUs due to high demand from Chinese customers.

title: Oracle reportedly delays several new OpenAI data centers because of shortages  tight material and labor supply frustrate expansion plans, possibly by a year or more
summary: Oracle delays some of the OpenAI data centers from 2027 to 2028 due to labor and materials shortages.

title: Jump on $740 worth of hardware, including $410 worth of DDR5 RAM, in this $480 Newegg AM5 bundle  32GB offering also includes an X870E motherboard and even a free 240mm AIO cooler
summary: Save money on RAM with this Newegg combo deal that pairs 32GB of DDR5 RAM with an X870E motherboard, and free 240mm AIO cooler for just $480

title: Intel Core Ultra 7 270K Plus and Core Ultra 9 290K Plus spotted at Indian retailer
summary: Retail listings appear to corroborate prior leaks but don't reveal pricing or new info for upcoming Arrow Lake refresh

title: Huawei's latest mobile is armed with China's most advanced process node to date despite using blacklisted chipmaker
summary: Huawei's Kirin 9030 is built on SMIC's N+3 process, an incremental extension of its 7nm-class technology that doesn't match true 5nm nodes.

title: This ginormous 28TB Seagate hard drive offers unbeatable value storage for just under 15 per TB pre-order this shuckable external HDD for only 419.99 at Amazon
summary: Seagate's 28TB Expansion HDD provides huge backup storage for under $15 per TB.

title: Framework raises DDR5 RAM upgrade prices by 50% amid DRAM shortage   only for Laptop DIY edition, says prices will likely rise again
summary: Framework, the computer manufacturer, has raised the price of DDR5 memory options for the Framework Laptop DIY Edition by 50% due to a DRAM shortage, and prices may increase further.

title: Photonic latch memory could enable optical processor caches that run up to 60 GHz, twenty times faster than standard caches   optical SRAM stores and outputs data entirely as light, but density challenges remain
summary: Researchers from the University of Southern California Information Sciences Institute and the University of Wisconsin-Madison have demonstrated the first regenerative photonic memory latch.

title: Intel tests chipmaking tools from sanctioned China-focused tool maker, report claims
summary: Intel has evaluated wet etch tools from ACM Research for its 14A fabrication process, raising political and national security concerns.

title: This $549 Acer gaming laptop is simply unbeatable value with Nvidia RTX 5050 GPU and 16GB RAM  rival model also on sale for $50 more, featuring AMD Ryzen CPU and 1200p display
summary: Acer Nitro V gaming laptops with Nvidia GeForce RTX GPUs are on sale for $549, offering unbeatable value compared to a rival model available for $50 more.

title: China mulls $70 billion domestic chip fabrication injection, would be largest of any government semiconductor investment
summary: China is considering investing up to $70 billion in its domestic chip manufacturers to compete with US firms like Nvidia.

title: Acer Predator X34 X0 34-inch Mini LED 200 Hz gaming monitor review: Ultra wide, ultra fast, and ultra bright
summary: The Acer Predator X34 X0 features a 34-inch ultra-wide display with 3440x1440 resolution, Adaptive-Sync Quantum Dot color, HDR 1000, and a 1500R curve, offering a 200 Hz refresh rate.

title: PNY's RTX 5070 GPU falls $50 below its MSRP launch price
summary: Grab an RTX 5070 from PNY for just $499, $50 below the MSRP launch price. Limited stock available at Walmart.

title: Here are the top ten PowerShell commands in Windows that will get you started
summary: PowerShell is a powerful tool that every Windows power user needs to learn, with the top ten commands to get you started.

title: Rivian unveils its own in-house RAP1 AI chip and ACM3 self-driving platform automaker one-ups Tesla with LiDAR support
summary: Rivian has unveiled its ACM3 self-driving platform and RAP1 AI chip, which includes LiDAR support. This one-ups Tesla in the field of autonomous driving. The ACM3 module and RAP1 chip are both in-house developments from Rivian.

title: Cambricon targets 500,000 AI chips in 2026 as China accelerates domestic hardware push
summary: Cambricon Technologies aims for a huge production ramp-up of 500,000 AI chips in 2026, but low yields and limited HBM supply might threaten their ambitions.

title: Nintendo Switch 2 RAM prices rise 41%, NAND flash up 8% console giant shares nosedive in face of increased cost warnings
summary: Nintendo's market cap decreased by $14 billion due to RAM shortages and price increases. The Nintendo Switch 2's RAM prices rose 41% and NAND flash prices increased by 8%. This led to a decline in the company's shares.

title: Outlet' RAM sold in Japan as new with huge markups, scuffed packaging Crucial DDR5-5600 64GB kit commands $600 overseas as AI shortage bites
summary: A Japanese retailer, Sofmap, is selling Crucial's Pro DDR5-5600 C46 64GB (2x32GB) memory kit for $602.74, taking advantage of the AI shortage.

title: Hoto's electric screwdriver set is a hobbyist's ultimate Christmas gift for less than 29 record-low price for 12-bit precision kit with USB-C charging, perfect for PC builds and DIY
summary: Grab this impressive Hoto NEX O1 Pro mini electric screwdriver set with 12 bits at a record-low price, perfect for PC builds and DIY.

title: Chinese government wades into Dutch chipmaker dispute presses Netherlands to resolve Nexperia saga as supply concerns grow
summary: China has called on the Netherlands to resolve the dispute surrounding Nexperia, which has disrupted shipments of components due to supervision measures and a retaliatory export freeze.

title: Asus' new 5K gaming monitor is so high-end it doesn't even officially support RTX 40-series GPUs
summary: Asus has released the XG27JCG, a 5K 180Hz monitor that requires Nvidia's RTX 50-series or AMD's RX 7600 and up to run, featuring solid color accuracy, HDR support, and 330Hz 1440p dual-mode support.

title: CyberPower's Supreme gaming PC packs 64GB of DDR5-6400 RAM and an RTX 5080 GPU for $2499
summary: CyberPower's Supreme gaming PC with an RTX 5080 GPU and 64GB of DDR5-6400 RAM is available for $2499, a good deal considering current RAM prices.

title: ASRock X870E Taichi OCF Motherboard Review: The right formula for extreme AMD overclocking
summary: ASRock's X870E Taichi OCF is a well-designed motherboard with high-end features for manual overclocking.

title: Intel fails to get EU antitrust ruling overturned in longstanding 16-year AMD competition case
summary: Intel lost its challenge to overturn an EU antitrust ruling, resulting in a $278 million fine.

title: TSMC ponders upgrading 2nd Japan fab to 4nm   could pave the way for more advanced chips for Japanese customers (Updated)
summary: TSMC is reportedly considering upgrading its 2nd Japan fab to 4nm, which could lead to more advanced chips for Japanese customers.

title: Biwin Black Opal OC Lab Gold Edition DDR5-6000 C28 4x48GB Review: High-Performance Memory For Demanding Applications
summary: Biwin launches a special DDR5-6000 192GB memory kit from its OC labs, aiming to outperform the current competition.

title: UC Berkeley Ph.D. candidate busted repeatedly sabotaging rival student's computer, causing $46,000 in damages hidden camera sting catches perp causing "sparks to fly out of the laptop," student arrested on three felony counts
summary: A UC Berkeley Ph.D. student was arrested on three felony counts for repeatedly sabotaging a rival student's computer, causing $46,000 in damages, as shown by a hidden camera.

title: Score a new Bambu Lab 3D printer for as little as 149 in this massive UK end-of-year sale
summary: Save on top 3D printers this Christmas in Bambu Lab's end-of-year sale with up to 20% off printers and 46% off filament.

title: RAM scalping takes hold on eBay, some DDR5 selling for more than $2,000
summary: Scalpers are selling memory kits at exorbitant prices on platforms like eBay, exploiting the memory shortage and adding almost double the markup on already inflated prices.

title: Microsoft, Google, OpenAI, and Anthropic join forces to form Agentic AI alliance, according to report
summary: The world's leading AI firms are collaborating on a new Agentic Artificial Intelligence Foundation to build open standards around AI agents, focusing on three key open source tools.

title: Dev gambles on 'obviously fake' $8K Grace Hopper system, scores $80,000 worth of hardware on Reddit for one-tenth of the cost
summary: A developer purchased a used Nvidia Grace Hopper system at a significantly low cost, which required cleaning and repair to get it running smoothly.

title: Prusa brings Noctua's iconic beige and brown to 3D printer nozzleheads everywhere accurately matching 3D printed parts to Noctua gear is now trivial
summary: Prusa releases Noctua color-matched 3D printing filaments

title: Basement AI lab captures 10,000 hours of brain scans to train thought-to-text AI models
summary: Conduit has collected 10,000 hours of neural data from thousands of individuals over six months in a basement studio.

title: China starts list of government-approved AI hardware suppliers: Cambricon and Huawei are in, Nvidia is not
summary: The Chinese government has added domestic AI hardware suppliers to the Information Technology Innovation List to accelerate deployment of domestic hardware. This move aims to boost the local AI industry. However, the question remains if the Chinese semiconductor industry can meet the needs of the domestic AI industry.

title: User reports claim December Windows 11 security update fixes AMD GPU hanging and driver crashing
summary: A multitude of AMD GPU owners claim the December security update for Windows 11 has fixed GPU hanging and driver crashing, primarily on RX 9000 series GPUs.

title: Framework puts Dell and Apple on blast over egregious RAM prices
summary: Memory prices are rising, affecting modular laptop maker Framework, which has announced a price hike. The company responded to a tweet criticizing Dell's RAM markup, which was later found to be incorrect.

title: Bambu Lab's end-of-year sale is live with up to 35% off score huge discounts on 3D printers and accessories while you can
summary: Save on some of the best 3D printers in Bambu Lab's end-of-year sale

title: The Nvidia H200 export saga, as it happened
summary: The U.S. government has approved the export of Nvidia's high-performance H200 AI chips to China, reinstating access.

title: Nvidia decries 'far-fetched' reports of smuggling in face of DeepSeek training reports
summary: Nvidia denies involvement in a 'phantom data center' smuggling scheme to get Blackwell GPU servers into China for training its newest LLM generation, despite some evidence to the contrary.

title: UP Xtreme ARL AI Dev Kit review: Benchmarks and AI workloads on an Intel Core Ultra 5 225H Arrow Lake SBC
summary: This review reports on the UP Xtreme ARL AI Dev Kit with a 14-core Intel Core Ultra 5 225H Arrow Lake single board computer, which delivers up to 83 TOPS of AI performance. The system runs Ubuntu 24.04 Pro and was tested with benchmarks and AI workloads using Nx Meta and the AAEON UP AI Toolkit. It is the third review in a series of Intel-based AI development kits.

title: CIX releases P1 CPU TRM and developer guides for GPU, AI accelerator, OS and firmware/BIOS
summary: CIX has released the technical reference manual for the P1 Arm Cortex-A720/A520 SoC, along with developer guides for GPU, AI accelerator, OS, and firmware. This marks a slow but steady progress in the open-source ecosystem. The P1 processor is expected to offer performance similar to Apple M1 and Qualcomm 8cx Gen3 platforms at an affordable price.

title: Diptyx E-Reader An open-source, ESP32-powered, dual-screen e-book reader (Crowdfunding)
summary: The Diptyx E-Reader features two e-paper displays that can be folded or opened, powered by an ESP32-S3 wireless module with a PCB antenna. It supports loading EPUB files through the USB Type-C port and has an automatic standby mode for weeks-long battery life. The device has two buttons for navigating pages and one for powering on.

title: Renesas RA6W1/RA6W2 Cortex-M33 wireless MCUs offer dual-band Wi-Fi 6, BLE, Matter, 15-year availability
summary: Renesas has added the RA6W1/RA6W2 MCUs to its RA6 family with dual-band Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth LE, and Matter connectivity. Both models feature a 160 MHz Arm Cortex-M33 core and support eMMC/SD, O-QSPI, and QSPI. They target smart home, wearables, industrial, and consumer IoT markets.

title: nRF9151 SMA DK development kit offers cellular IoT, DECT NR+, and 5G NTN satellite connectivity
summary: Nordic Semiconductor's nRF9151 SMA DK development kit provides IoT applications with LTE-M/NB-IoT cellular IoT, DECT NR+, or 5G NTN satellite connectivity, featuring a multimode LTE-M/NB-IoT/NB-NTN modem with DECT NR+ support and GNSS.

title: UP Squared Pro TWL AI Dev Kit Review Intel N150 + Hailo-8L accelerator tested on Ubuntu 24.04
summary: The reviewer tests the UP Squared Pro TWL AI devkit with an Intel N150 CPU and a Hailo-8L AI accelerator on Ubuntu 24.04, installing an NVMe SSD for expanded storage and running benchmarks.

title: Up to 16-core AMD EPYC Embedded 2005 Series Zen 5 processors support up 28 PCIe Gen5 lanes, offer 10-year availability
summary: AMD has released the EPYC Embedded 2005 Series, a mid-range processor family based on the Zen 5 architecture, supporting up to 16 cores, 28 PCIe Gen5 lanes, and 10 years of availability.

title: iWave Systems iG-RainboW-G69M TI AM62L OSM Size-S system-on-module powers Raspberry Pi-sized SBC
summary: iWave Systems iG-RainboW-G69M is a 30x30mm system-on-module with a Texas Instruments AM62L dual-core Cortex-A53 SoC, 1GB or 2GB LPDDR4, and 8GB eMMC flash. It has 332 LGA contacts exposing various interfaces. The module powers a Raspberry Pi-sized carrier board.

title: IoT HDMI switch An ESP32-C3-powered 2-source HDMI switch automated with Home Assistant
summary: The IoT HDMI Switch is an ESP32-C3-based open-source HDMI switch that integrates with Home Assistant to automate up to two HDMI inputs. It targets smart home setups and includes a 3D-printed enclosure for a compact install behind media equipment. It supports automations and works with common HDMI devices like Chromecast and consoles.

title: AMD Ryzen Embedded 8840U COM Express Type 6 Compact module takes up to 128GB DDR5
summary: SolidRun has unveiled a new COM Express Type 6 Compact module powered by the AMD Ryzen Embedded 8840U Series with up to 39 TOPS of AI performance for industrial, medical, automation, and edge AI applications.

title: STEVAL-ROBKIT1 A robot evaluation kit based on STM32H725 and STM32G0 microcontrollers
summary: The STEVAL-ROBKIT1 is an evaluation kit for robotics applications based on ST's STM32H725 and STM32G0 Arm microcontrollers, featuring a main board, motor-control PCB, camera, and robotic frame.

title: 52Pi UPS Gen 6 UPS for Raspberry Pi 4/5 supports up to 4x external battery packs, PikaPython scripting
summary: The 52Pi UPS Gen 6 is a power solution for Raspberry Pi 4/5 that supports external battery packs, I2C, and PikaPython scripting for power management. It features a physical power button, 12V power interface, and bumpless power transfer. The board includes an aluminum heatsink with an automatic fan.

title: Beacon AM62L A compact (38x28mm), low-power dual-core Cortex-A53 System-on-Module (SoM)
summary: Beacon EmbeddedWorks announced a compact System-on-Module (SoM) based on the Texas Instruments Sitara AM62L dual-core Cortex-A53 SoC, designed for IoT, HMI, and general-purpose applications.

title: 7.3-inch full color e-paper wooden photo frame is designed for the Raspberry Pi Zero
summary: A 7.3-inch color e-paper photo frame designed for the Raspberry Pi Zero with E-Ink Spectra 6 display, rotatable stand, and wall mounting support.

title: FlashESP is an all-in-one web-based tool for ESP32/ESP8266 Arduino development and firmware flashing
summary: FlashESP is a web-based tool that allows development of Arduino sketches and firmware flashing for ESP32 and ESP8266 platforms with real-time compilation and one-click flashing.

title: Radxa C200 Orin Developer Kit An NVIDIA Jetson Orin NX 8GB devkit with three M.2 PCIe 4.0 slots
summary: The Radxa C200 is a compact developer kit built around the NVIDIA Jetson Orin NX 8GB module, featuring high-speed storage expansion, fast-bootable SSDs, and data-intensive AI workloads.

title: NestDisk An Intel N150 NAS, mini PC, and AI Box with four M.2 PCIe slots
summary: NestDisk is an Intel N150 mini PC that can be used as a NAS or AI box, featuring four M.2 PCIe slots, 12GB LPDDR5 memory, and a 64GB eMMC flash.

title: Quarky Intellio  A LEGO-compatible AI, Augmented Reality, and IoT learning platform (Crowdfunding)
summary: Quarky Intellio is an ESP32-S3-based development kit compatible with LEGO bricks, designed for learning AI, AR, and IoT concepts.

title: Nordic nRF7002 EBII adds dual-band Wi-Fi 6 to nRF54L series development kits
summary: Nordic has introduced the nRF7002 EBII as an updated Wi-Fi 6 expansion board for its nRF54L series development kits, featuring dual-band Wi-Fi 6 support, power-profiling options, and more.

title: YumiAI: An AI-Native End-to-End Hardware Innovation Platform For Embedded Engineers (Sponsored)
summary: YumiAI is a multi-agent engineering stack that helps with custom board design by interpreting requirements, selecting components, generating circuit schematics, and validating ideas. It aims to simplify the hardware workflow process. This platform is currently in production-ready stage for market and business layers.

title: AQEX qUPS-P-BC-2.0 UPS HAT works with large capacity, multi-chemistry batteries (Li-Ion, LiFePO4, Sodium-Ion)
summary: AQEX qUPS-P-BC-2.0 is a UPS HAT that supports multi-chemistry batteries, with offline UPS-like architecture, adjustable input voltage, and communication with Raspberry Pi through GPIO pins.

title: ESP32-C6-Devkit-Lipo A small, open-source hardware ESP32-C6 board with battery support, UEXT connector
summary: The Olimex ESP32-C6-DevKit-Lipo is a small, open-source hardware board with support for LiPo batteries, dual USB-C design, and a UEXT connector. It features the ESP32-C6 SoC with WiFi 6, Bluetooth 5.0 LE, and Zigbee/Thread capabilities. The board is designed for breadboard compatibility and low-power applications.

title: ExtrudeX machine recycles failed/old 3D prints into new filament (Crowdfunding)
summary: A 3D printable machine, ExtrudeX, recycles 3D print waste and filament scraps back into usable filament.

title: Rikomagic DS08 A Rockchip RK3588-powered 8K digital signage player with RTC and watchdog support
summary: Rikomagic DS08 is a Rockchip RK3588-powered Android 13 digital signage player with better specifications compared to the previous model, including an octa-core CPU, 8GB of RAM, a 128GB eMMC flash, and 8K and 4K HDMI video outputs.

title: Edgi-Talk machine learning development kit features Infineon PSOC Edge E84 Edge AI SoC (Crowdfunding)
summary: Edgi-Talk is a machine learning platform/development kit powered by the Infineon PSOC Edge E84 SoC, featuring Arm Helium and an ultra-low-power NNLite neural network accelerator. It comes with various sensors, a touchscreen display, and wireless connectivity for expansion. The devkit includes a Raspberry Pi header for further expansion.

title: Mini review of JOYROOM PODIX 140W 5-port USB GaN charger with power meter function
summary: The reviewer unboxed and tested the JOYROOM PODIX 140W 5-port USB GaN charger, which integrates a power meter function for whole charger and individual ports, and found it useful for reviews of USB-powered boards and devices.

title: Olimex LT8912B-based MIPI-HDMI adapter board adds HDMI output to the ESP32-P4-Devkit board
summary: Olimex MIPI-HDMI adapter board outputs up to 1080p60 8-bit HDMI via its LT8912B converter and supports 1 to 4 MIPI DSI data lanes in continuous-clock mode.

title: Jetway B420UADN1 fanless Intel N97 mini PC supports three 4K displays for kiosks and digital signage applications
summary: The Jetway B420UADN1 is a compact, fanless mini PC for kiosks and digital signage with support for three 4K displays through multiple interfaces, DDR5 memory, and M.2 storage, among other features.

title: MetaComputing AI PC with Framework Laptop 13 features CIX P1 12-core Arm processor with up to 45 TOPS
summary: MetaComputing has announced the MetaComputing AI PC with a 12-core Cortex-A720/A520 SoC and up to 45 TOPS, available in two models: Standard and Pro.

title: Silicognition ManT1S ESP32 board supports T1S single-pair Ethernet for robotics and automation (Crowdfunding)
summary: The Silicognition ManT1S ESP32 board supports T1S single-pair Ethernet for robotics and automation projects. It uses the IEEE 802.3cg networking standard for networking and power distribution over a single pair of wires. The board features a Qwicc connector for I2C expansion and unpopulated headers for GPIOs and programming.

title: Nordic nRF54LV10A is a tiny, low-voltage Bluetooth LE SoC for battery-powered medical devices
summary: Nordic Semi has unveiled the nRF54LV10A ultra-low-power, low-voltage Bluetooth LE SoC for battery-powered medical devices such as trackers, wearable biosensors, and continuous glucose monitors.

title: Tyr A Rust GPU driver for Arm Mali GPUs
summary: A new Rust GPU driver, Tyr, has been released for CSF-based Arm Mali GPUs. It's a port of the Panthor C driver and aims to replace it eventually. The Tyr driver works with GNOME, Weston, and 3D games like SuperTuxKart.
